channel.title: Intelligence
channel.description: Hey, Jc made a post on a thread saying intelligence is relative and that got to thinking what is your opinions and conclusions on the matter. This is my thoughts on the matter so far as of 27/01/2013 (for the US, it'd be 01/27/2013 I believe) Intelligence is relative to the environment the subject is in however that would make the intelligence the environment? But if that's true then we possess no intelligence however that cannot be true otherwise we wouldn't have evolved etc. But then again is all that we've done intelligent or are we just perceiving it to be intelligent. What is intelligence?

item.title: Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Well, then there’s really nothing to discuss here. It’s not really a debate and you’re close-minded to other thoughts relating to intelligence. You can post this in General Questions if you are still looking for someone to define intelligence.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m no longer going to talk about anything to do with evolution etc, the discussion is about intelligence. You may of course debate it with others, I have no interest in the matter.

Read full topic

item.title: Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

We’re the dominant species (in a sense) due to a seemingly detrimental delay of our cognitive development.

Read full topic

item.title: Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:9, topic:480106”]Your genes need to basically have the correct instructions to adapt the best way possible to support life? Theirs a lot of meanings evolution has - more than mentioned but seriously evolution is not the point.
Only on moparscape people pick at things that don’t matter. “I wasn’t really thinking about it as in depth as the other parts I stated.” (previous post)[/quote]

Oh yes, our genes have little brains and are given instructions to follow step by step, written out on a piece of paper. Gotcha now.

Sarcasm

Read full topic

item.description:

Your genes need to basically have the correct instructions to adapt the best way possible to support life? Theirs a lot of meanings evolution has - more than mentioned but seriously evolution is not the point.

item.title: Intelligence
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Could you please explain to me how it takes intelligence to evolve? There’s something I’m not grasping here. Also, it depends what your definition of intelligence is.

EDIT: Now that I’ve thought about it a bit, it depends what type of evolving you’re talking about. As for physical or biological evolution, it takes no intelligence what-so-ever. On the other hand, if you’re talking progressions in the world such as in technology, then yeah, that’s true, you need intelligence. I mean, we haven’t made any huge progressions recently in the world primarily because technology is making a large portion of society un-intelligent, however, it makes some more intelligent. There’s two different types of ‘evolution’ though one is our progressions as human beings, which were you talking about?

Read full topic

you don’t need intelligence to evolve[/quote]
